p:
Similarly, a decrease in mosquito lifespan (the second prevention program) with effectiveness θ, i.e., the reduction of mosquito lifespan by θ times, changes our model causing

. With such prevention programs, the prevalence of ZIKV decreases to a negligible level when mosquito death is increased by at least a factor of three, i.e., θ ≥ 3 (Fig. 5). Also, this prevention effort can reduce the final outbreak size from about 100% to nearly 10%.
